meta.title: Operation of Emergency Eye Wash Station

sections.purpose: To provide immediate decontamination of eyes in case of exposure to hazardous chemicals or foreign bodies.
sections.scope: Applicable to emergency safety procedures in the Pharmaceutical Chemistry Laboratory.
procedure: Locate the eye wash station immediately after a chemical splash.
Push the activation handle or press the foot pedal to start the water flow.
Hold eyelids open with fingers to ensure effective flushing of the ocular surface.
Lower eyes into the water stream and rotate the eyeballs to flush all areas.
Continue flushing for at least 15 minutes without interruption.
Seek medical attention immediately after the flushing process is complete.
Ensure the station is tested weekly to verify proper water flow and pressure.
Document weekly inspections in the laboratory safety logbook.
precautions: Do not use high-pressure water streams directly on the eyes.
Ensure the water is tepid (16-38Â°C) to prevent thermal shock.
Remove contact lenses immediately if possible during the flushing process.
Keep the eye wash station clear of any obstructions at all times.
Always wear appropriate eye protection to prevent accidents.
